sentences.src_sentence: 경제난 극복을 위한 정부 재계 합동의 긴급 비상대책위원회였던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was a critical response committee created to overcome the economic crisis by the government and business community.

sentences.src_sentence: 1970년 4월에 착공한 103만 톤 규모의 포항제철 본 공장은 1973년 7월에 준공됐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Pohang Steel's core plant with a capacity of 1.03 million tons, construction started in April 1970, was completed in July 1973.

sentences.src_sentence: 그것은 평범한 경제 정책이 아니라 매우 특별한 국가 방위전략이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Rather than being a typical economic policy, it was a very special national defense strategy.

sentences.src_sentence: 제조업도 경공업에서 중화학공업으로 옮겨가는 수순을 밟았고, 새마을사업과 이중곡가제도 도입을 통해 그동안 소홀했던 농촌과 농업에도 신경을 쓰기 시작했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When the manufacturing industry also turned from the light industry to the heavy chemical industry, via the introduction of the Saemaul project and the double grain price system, it started to focus on rural areas and agriculture, which had previously been neglected.

sentences.src_sentence: 한 차례 박정희 업적에 후한 평가를 보태기 시작한 계기는 1997년 외환위기를 맞으면서였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: During the Asian financial crisis in 1997 Park Chung-hee's achievements were evaluated generously.

sentences.src_sentence: 한편으로 그녀는 푸틴 대통령에게 휴전 협정을 존중하지 않고 계속해서 분리주의자들에게 군사적인 지원을 한다면, 더 강력한 제재 조치가 뒤따를 것이란 점을 확실히 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: On the one hand, Putin was made to understand that if the ceasefire agreement was not respected and continued to provide military aid to separatists, stronger sanctions would follow.

sentences.src_sentence: 정권 말기에 이르러 박종철 고문치사 사건이 터지고, 6・29선언을 계기로 정치적으로 엄청난 어려움에 처하면서도 경제 정책만은 전혀 위축됨이 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Despite the significant political challenges that followed the June 29 Declaration and the torture and death of Park Jong-cheol at the end of the regime, the economic strategy did not change at all.

sentences.src_sentence: 중앙일보 뉴욕특파원, 경제부장, 일본총국장, 편집국장, 경제대기자를 역임했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: He served as a JoongAng Ilbo New York correspondent, Director of the Economic Department, Director General of Japan, Editor-in-Chief, and Economic correspondent.

sentences.src_sentence: 모든 경제부처를 출입한 전천후 경제기자였으며, 10년간 기명 칼럼을 썼다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: He was an all-rounder economic reporter who had access to all economic departments, and wrote a named column for 10 years.

sentences.src_sentence: 저널리스트 생활을 마감한 뒤 하이트진로 대표이사 부회장과 삼정 KPMG 부회장 등을 지냈다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: After wrapping up his career as a journalist, he served as vice chairman of Hite Jinro and as vice chairman of Samjong KPMG.

sentences.src_sentence: 모교인 서강대학교에서 초빙교수로서 ‘대통령의 경제학’을 4년째 강의하고 있다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: He has been teaching “Presidential Economics” for 4 years as a visiting professor at Sogang University, his alma mater.

sentences.src_sentence: 세계경제 흐름의 변화 속에서 지구촌 곳곳을 누비며 많은 글을 썼으며, BRICs, 이머징마켓, 자원전쟁 등에 주목해 『19단의 비밀, 다음은 인도다』 『카스피해 에너지 전쟁』 등의 저서를 펴낸 바 있다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In the midst of changes in the world economy, he has written many articles while traveling around the world, wrote on BRICs, emerging markets, and resource wars, and has published books such as 『Next is India』 and 『Caspian Sea Energy War』.

sentences.src_sentence: 『경제는 당신이 대통령이야』 『경제가 민주화를 만났을 때』 『대통령의 경제학』을 통해 한국경제의 발전과정을 집대성하였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The development process of the Korean economy was compiled in 『For the economy, you are the president』, 『When the economy meets democratization" and 『Presidential economics』.

sentences.src_sentence: 들어가며 경제는 어렵고 골치 아프다고 생각하는 사람들이 많다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There are many people who think that economics is difficult and annoying.

sentences.src_sentence: 만약 한국경제를 통계나 이론적 분석은 피하고 사람 중심의 옛날이야기처럼 풀어나간다면 훨씬 쉽고 재미있게 받아들여졌을 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: If we avoided statistical or theoretical analysis of the Korean economy and solved it like an old story centered around people, it would have been much easier and more enjoyable.

sentences.src_sentence: 실제로 한국경제의 발전 과정은 그 자체가 어떤 이야기보다 드라마틱하고 흥미진진하다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In fact, the development process of the Korean economy is more dramatic and exciting than any story.

sentences.src_sentence: 필자가 쓴 『대통령의 경제학』을 쉽게 풀어서 재구성했으며, 전문 지식이나 경제용어를 몰라도 술술 읽어 나갈 수 있도록 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: 『Presidential Economics』 was easily solved and reconstructed, and it became possible to read without professional knowledge or knowledge on economic terminology.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방 이후의 현대 한국경제사를 리더십 관점에서 살펴본 것이기도 하다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It is also a study of modern Korean economic history after liberation from the perspective of leadership.

sentences.src_sentence: 편의상 초대 대통령 이승만부터 박정희, 전두환까지의 40년을 산업화 시대로, 노태우부터 김영삼, 김대중, 노무현, 이명박까지의 25년을 민주화 시대로 나눴다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: For convenience, the 40 years from the first president Lee Seung-man to Park Chung-hee and Chun Doo-hwan are divided into the industrialization era, while the 25 years from Roh Tae-woo to Kim Young-sam, Kim Dae-jung, Roh Moo-hyun, and Lee Myung-bak are divided into the democratization era.

sentences.src_sentence: ‘대통령의 한국경제 이야기’를 하다 보면 한국경제의 발전 과정은 저절로 이해될 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When talking about ‘the Presidents’ stories of the Korean economy’, it is possible to automatically understand the development process of the Korean economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 주인공은 역대 대통령들이고, 이들의 정책과 리더십이 한국경제를 어떻게 꾸려나갔는지에 초점을 맞춰 이야기를 풀었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The main characters are the former presidents, and the stories were told with a focus on how their policies and leadership managed the Korean economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 돌이켜 보면 건국 당시의 한국경제는 국제적으로 천덕꾸러기였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Looking back, the Korean economy at the time of its national foundation was internationally a nuisance.

sentences.src_sentence: 워낙 가난했을 뿐 아니라, 실제로 아슬아슬한 붕괴 위기가 한두 번이 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Not only were they incredibly poor, the economy was actually on the brink of collapse.

sentences.src_sentence: 전문가들 말대로라면 한국경제는 이미 망해도 여러 차례 망해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: According to experts, the Korean economy had to collapse several times.

sentences.src_sentence: 선진국이나 국제기구의 충고를 무시하고 한국식을 고집한 경우도 많았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In many cases, the government ignored the advice of developed countries or international organizations and insisted on applying Korean styles.

sentences.src_sentence: 최근의 경제위기를 맞아 내로라하던 강대국들도 한국 경험을 벤치마킹하는 데 서슴지 않는다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In the face of the recent economic crisis, even the most powerful countries do not hesitate to benchmark Korea's experience.

sentences.src_sentence: 대학의 경제학과에서도 미국에서 유행하는 이론을 가르치기만 할 뿐, 제 나라 경제가 무슨 고초를 겪고 어떻게 발전해 왔는지는 관심 밖이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even the economics departments at universities only teach theories that are popular in the United States, and are not interested in what kind of hardships our country's economy has gone through and how it has developed.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제학을 전공하나 영문학을 공부하나 한국경제를 잘 모르기는 별 차이가 없다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There is no difference between majoring in economics and studying English literature in terms of being unfamiliar with the Korean economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 한국경제는 ‘사람’을 빼고는 제대로 설명할 수 없다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The Korean economy cannot be properly explained without the ‘people’.

sentences.src_sentence: 한국은 자원도 돈도 없이 오로지 사람만을 유일한 밑천으로 삼아 오늘의 경제를 일궈냈다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The nation of Korea built today's economy with only people as its only source of money, without resources or money.

sentences.src_sentence: 역대 대통령의 리더십을 거론하지 않고서는 건국 이후 한국경제의 발전과정을 논하기 어렵다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It is difficult to discuss the process of the development of the Korean economy since the foundation of the country without mentioning the leadership of former presidents.

sentences.src_sentence: 대통령의 경제치적을 시대별로 살펴보는 것만으로도 한국경제를 이해하는 데 큰 도움이 될 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Simply taking a look at the presidents’ economic achievements by era will be of great help in understanding the Korean economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 장기집권으로 외국에 쫓겨나는 대통령부터 시작해, 최측근에게 암살당한 대통령, 비자금 축재로 감옥에 간 대통령, 자식들의 비리로 망신당한 대통령, 심지어 검찰 조사 중에 자살한 대통령까지 나왔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Starting with a president who was kicked out of the country for a long period of time, a president who was assassinated by a close aide, a president who went to prison for accumulating slush funds, a president who was disgraced for corruption thanks to his children, and even a president who committed suicide while being investigated by prosecutors.

sentences.src_sentence: 역대 대통령들은 하나같이 뒤끝이 좋지 않았던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Almost every former president has not had a good ending.

sentences.src_sentence: 잘못에 대한 비판과는 별개로, 경제 발전과정에서 발휘한 역대 대통령의 역할과 리더십은 그것대로 냉정하게 평가돼야 한다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Apart from criticism of mistakes they have made, the role and leadership of past presidents in the process of economic development must be evaluated with a relaxed mind.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만은 공산화를 막아내며 자본주의 경제의 기틀을 다진 건국 대통령이었으며, 박정희는 오늘의 한국경제를 있게 한 한국판 산업혁명을 주도했고, 전두환은 40년 동안 겪었던 고질적인 인플레이션을 잡았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Syngman Rhee was the founding president who stopped communism and laid the foundation for the capitalist economy, Park Chung-hee led the Korean version of the Industrial Revolution that made today's Korean economy possible, and Chun Doo-hwan halted the chronic inflation the country had experienced for 40 years.

sentences.src_sentence: 노태우는 민주화를 감당해내는 가운데 북방 정책의 길을 텄고, 김영삼은 금융실명제 같은 어려운 개혁조치를 단행했으며, 김대중은 외환위기를 조기에 극복하고 복지 정책을 본격화한 대통령이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: While handling democratization, Roh Tae-woo paved the way for the Northward Policy, Kim Young-sam carried out difficult reform measures such as the real-name financial system, and Kim Dae-jung was the president who overcame the foreign exchange crisis early and implemented welfare policies in earnest.

sentences.src_sentence: 노무현은 돈 선거를 청산하고 사회통합이라는 새로운 시대정신을 제시했으며, 이명박은 잇따라 터진 미국발 금융위기와 유럽의 재정위기 등을 무난히 넘겼다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Roh Moo-hyun liquidated the money election and presented a new era of social integration, and Lee Myung-bak overcame successive financial crises in the United States and Europe's fiscal crisis without too much difficulty.

sentences.src_sentence: 구체적인 잘잘못을 떠나, 역대 대통령들이 각자의 시대에 저마다 역할을 해 왔던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Regardless of the specific rights or wrongs, each president played a role in his own era.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제를 사람 중심으로 살피는 것에도 위험부담이 따른다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Taking a people-focused look at the economy also carries risks.

sentences.src_sentence: 박정희 경제를 일방적으로 미화한다든지, 노무현 경제 중 잘한 정책만 골라서 칭송하는 것 등은 모두 경계해야 한다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: We should be wary of unilaterally thinking Park Chung-hee's economy was good or praising only the best policies of Roh Moo-hyun's economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 어느 한 쪽에 치우치지 않고 철저하게 사실에 근거해야 한다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: We must be thoroughly factually based and not biased towards either side.

sentences.src_sentence: 앞뒤 사정이나 정치 환경 또한 중요한 요인이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Context and political environment are also important factors.

sentences.src_sentence: 전임자 재임 시절에는 비판받던 정책이 후임자 대에 와서 시차를 두고 효과가 나타나는 경우도 허다했으며, 정치 환경에 따라 정책이 죽었다 살았다 하는 일도 무수했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There were many cases in which policies that were criticized during a predecessor's tenure came to the successor's generation and took effect with a lag, and depending on the political environment, there were countless things that killed or revived policies.

sentences.src_sentence: 이러한 사실 관계를 정확하게 파악해야 한국경제를 제대로 이해할 수 있다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: To properly understand the Korean economy, it is necessary to accurately grasp such facts.

sentences.src_sentence: 세상이 변하면 대통령의 권한이나 리더십도 당연히 바뀌게 마련이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As the world changes, the authority and leadership of a president will naturally change with it.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제도 많이 변했지만 정치 환경 또한 엄청나게 달라졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The economy has changed dramatically, but so has the political landscape.

sentences.src_sentence: 국회가 허수아비였을 때 대통령 권한은 무소불위였지만, 지금은 국회 동의 없이 되는 것은 하나도 없다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When the National Assembly was just a figurehead, the president's authority was indiscriminate, but now, nothing is done without the consent of the National Assembly.

sentences.src_sentence: 대통령의 리더십 또한 정치 환경에 따라 달라질 수밖에 없으며, 한국경제 자체가 경제논리의 한계를 뛰어넘어 정치적으로 결판나는 경우가 부쩍 늘었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The president's leadership inevitably changes depending on the political environment, and the number of cases in which the Korean economy itself goes beyond the limits of economic logic and becomes politically decisive has increased dramatically.

sentences.src_sentence: 이에 대한 해답을 찾는 노력은 결국 지금까지의 한국경제발전 과정을 제대로 이해하는 작업으로부터 시작돼야 할 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Efforts to find answers to these questions must eventually begin with a proper understanding of the Korean economic development process so far.

sentences.src_sentence: 영국이나 독일 등이 산업혁명으로 한창 잘 살 때 스위스는 남의 나라 전쟁에 용병으로 피를 팔면서 끼니를 이어갔던 나라였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When Britain and Germany were thriving prosperously thanks to the Industrial Revolution, Switzerland continued to earn its keep by selling blood as mercenaries in wars in other countries.

sentences.src_sentence: 그랬던 스위스가 뒤늦게 분발해서 지금은 세계 1등 부자 나라가 된 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This Switzerland worked hard a little later than others, and has now become the world's number one wealthy country.

sentences.src_sentence: 한국경제의 발전 과정을 이런 스위스에 견주는 사람들도 있다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Some people compare the development process of the Korean economy to that of Switzerland’s.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본의 식민지 통치에서 해방되었을 때 한국은 그야말로 세계에서 가장 가난한 나라였지만, 급속한 발전을 이룩해 지금은 선진국 대열에 들어섰기 때문이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This is because Korea had literally been the poorest country in the world when it was liberated from Japanese colonial rule, but it achieved rapid development and has now entered the ranks of advanced countries.

sentences.src_sentence: 1945년에 일본 식민지 통치로부터 해방되어 잃어버린 나라를 되찾기는 했으나 곧바로 미국 군대의 통치를 받아야 했고, 우여곡절 끝에 3년 뒤에나 대한민국 정부가 수립되었기 때문이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This is because although it was liberated from Japanese colonial rule in 1945 and regained its lost country, it had to be ruled by the US military right away, and after twists and turns, the government of the Republic of Korea was established three years afterwards.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방이 되었음에도 불구하고 스스로 정부를 세우지 못하고 남의 나라 통치를 3년이나 더 받아야 했다는 점은 매우 안타까운 일이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Despite being liberated, it was unfortunate that Korea was unable to set up its own government and had to be governed by another country for three years.

sentences.src_sentence: 한국경제가 훗날 북한과는 궤도를 달리하면서 지금의 경제적 성공을 이룩하는 데 미군정 3년간은 매우 중요한 시기였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The three years of U.S. military government was a very important period for the South Korean economy in achieving its present economic success while diverging from the trajectory of North Korea later.

sentences.src_sentence: 정확한 통계가 있지도 않았지만, 지금 식의 1인당 국민소득으로 따져서 대충 60~70달러 정도에 불과했던 것으로 추정된다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There are no exact statistics, but it is estimated that it was only about 60 to 70 dollars based on the current calculation of per capita income.

sentences.src_sentence: 아프리카까지 포함해서 세계에서 가장 가난한 나라 중 하나였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was one of the poorest countries in the world, including countries in Africa.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본이 만들어 놓은 36년간의 경제구조가 하루아침에 무너지면서 모든 것이 마비되고 혼란 속에 빠져들었기 때문이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This is because Japan's 36-year economic structure collapsed overnight, paralyzing everything and plunging the country into chaos.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본에 대한 증오는 증오이고, 일본인들이 빠져나가자마자 그들이 중심이 되어서 움직이던 경제가 하루아침에 엉망이 된 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Hatred of Japan was hatred, and as soon as the Japanese left, the economy that they played a central role in fell apart overnight.

sentences.src_sentence: 당시 한반도에 살던 일본인 숫자는 70만 명 안팎이었는데, 일본이 항복을 선언하면서 이들은 애써 내쫓지 않아도 서둘러 도망치듯 일본으로 돌아갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: At that time, the number of Japanese living on the Korean Peninsula was around 700,000, and when Japan declared surrender, they hurriedly returned to Japan without the country having to expel them.

sentences.src_sentence: 이는 지극히 당연한 일이었으나 좋아하기만 할만 일은 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This was perfectly normal, but it wasn't just something to be excited about.

sentences.src_sentence: 공장들이 멈춰 섰고 심각한 물자 부족 사태가 벌어졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Factories stopped functioning, and there was a serious shortage of supplies.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방 당시 주요산업시설의 94%가 일본인 소유였고, 조선인들이 경영하던 소위 민족기업은 불과 6%에 불과한 실정이니 그럴 수밖에 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: At the time of liberation, 94% of major industrial facilities were owned by Japanese people, while only 6% of the so-called national enterprises were run by Koreans.

sentences.src_sentence: 전체 공장의 절반가량은 아예 문을 닫았고, 기계가 있어도 가동을 할 수 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: About half of all factories were closed completely, and even if there were machines, they could not be operated.

sentences.src_sentence: 이런 형편에 북한이 전기 공급마저 중단하는 바람에 남한 전체는 암흑천지였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Meanwhile, North Korea stopped supplying electricity to the country, and the whole of South Korea was plunged into darkness.

sentences.src_sentence: 패전 위기에 몰린 일본이 제2차 세계대전 막판에 마구 돈을 찍어대는 바람에 물자부족 현상은 극심한데 돈은 잔뜩 많이 풀려 있는 상태였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As Japan, which was on the verge of defeat, printed a lot of money at the end of World War II, the material shortage was extreme, but there was a lot of money in the country.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정 또한 물자부족속에 필요한 돈을 통화 증발에 의존하는 가운데 해방 이후 3년 동안 물가는 30배 이상 올랐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The U.S. military government also relied on currency evaporation for necessary money amid material shortages, and prices rose more than x30 in the three years after liberation.

sentences.src_sentence: 조선은행 통계연보에 따르면, 남한 인구는 1944년의 1,656만 명에서 1946년에는 1,937만 명으로 불과 2년 사이에 280여만 명이 증가했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: According to the Statistical Yearbook of the Bank of Joseon, the population of South Korea increased from 16.56 million in 1944 to 19.37 million in 1946, an increase of 2.8 million in just two years.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한은 인구가 폭발적으로 증가하자 당장 굶주림을 해결해야 할 식량과 기초생필품이 문제였고, 더더욱 미국 원조에 기댈 수밖에 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As South Korea's population grew explosively, the issue of food and basic necessities needed to be solved to solve hunger immediately, and so the country had no choice but to rely on US aid even more.

sentences.src_sentence: 양곡의 절반을 미국의 원조 식량에 의존했고, 기초생필품도 전적으로 미국 구호물자로 충당해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The country relied on food aid from the United States for half of its grain, and had to supply basic necessities entirely with American relief supplies.

sentences.src_sentence: 이런 가난한 나라 남한에 대해 미국 정부는 ‘거의 희망이 없는 나라’로 분류하고 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Regarding South Korea, the US government classified it as a 'nearly hopeless country'.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국의 막대한 원조 속에 나라가 세워졌으나 얼마 안 있어서 터진 6·25전쟁 통에 다시 쑥대밭이 되었고, 박정희 시대가 시작되고 나서도 한참을 지나서야 겨우 일제 강점기 수준으로 회복되었다는 말이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The country was established with the enormous aid of the United States, but it was again ruined by the Korean War that broke out shortly thereafter. In other words, even after the Park Chung-hee era began, it was only after a long time that it was restored to the level it had been at during the Japanese colonial period.

sentences.src_sentence: 석탄을 비롯해 지하자원이 북한에 많이 있었기 때문에 압록강의 수풍발전소나 흥남의 비료 공장 등 큰 산업시설들은 대부분 북쪽에 쏠려 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Because there were many underground resources, including coal, in North Korea, most of the large industrial facilities, such as the Supoong Power Plant on the Yalu River and the fertilizer factory in Heungnam, were concentrated in the North.

sentences.src_sentence: 이 바람에 남한의 전기생산량은 북한의 1/10도 되지 못했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As a result, South Korea's electricity production was less than 1/10 of North Korea's.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제 환경뿐 아니라 정치사회 여건도 북한이 남한보다 앞섰다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Not only in the economic environment, but also in political and social conditions, North Korea was ahead of South Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국과 소련의 군대가 한반도를 남북으로 나눠서 점령했으나 양쪽의 사정은 많이 달랐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The armies of the United States and the Soviet Union divided the Korean Peninsula into North and South Korea, but the situations on both sides were very different.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한은 미군의 비교적 느슨한 통치 아래 정당이 난립하고 좌우로 갈라져 정치적 혼란이 극심했던 반면, 북한은 소련군의 치밀한 지시 아래 김일성을 중심으로 일사불란하게 공산정권을 구축해 나갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In South Korea, under relatively loose rule by the US military, political turmoil was severe as political parties sprang up and split into left and right sides. Meanwhile, North Korea built a communist regime in perfect order with Kim Il-sung at the center under the meticulous instructions of the Soviet Army.

sentences.src_sentence: 1946년 2월, ‘북조선인민위원회’를 구성해 사실상의 정부가 만들어졌고, 제대로 된 군대를 창설했으며, 소련한테서 들여 온 탱크로 탱크부대까지 만들었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In February 1946, the North Korean People's Committee was formed to form a de facto government, and they created a proper army, even making a tank unit with tanks imported from the Soviet Union.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한은 거주 일본인을 다 쫓아냈지만, 북한은 일본인 기술자 900여 명을 강제로 붙잡아 놓고 계속 일을 시켰다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: South Korea kicked out all of the Japanese, but North Korea forcibly detained around 900 Japanese engineers and forced them to continue working.

sentences.src_sentence: 그들이 없으면 비료 공장, 철강 공장 등 주요 산업 시설이 당장 멈추게 된다고 판단했기 때문이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This was because it was judged that without them, major industrial facilities such as fertilizer factories and steel factories would immediately halt.

sentences.src_sentence: 땅뿐 아니라 가축까지도 소작인들에게 무상으로 나눠 줬다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Not only land but also livestock were distributed to tenant farmers, free of charge.

sentences.src_sentence: 1947년 말에는 화폐개혁을 단행했고, 1949년에는 통일을 전제로 한 남한의 토지개혁계획까지 수립했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Currency reform was carried out at the end of 1947 and in 1949, a land reform plan was established in South Korea on the premise of reunification.

sentences.src_sentence: 실제로 이듬해 6·25전쟁을 일으켰을 때 점령지역을 대상으로 이때 준비했던 토지개혁을 실천에 옮기기도 했었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In fact, when the Korean War broke out the year after, land reform prepared at the time was put into practice, targeting occupied areas.

sentences.src_sentence: 북한이 신속한 체제 구축을 통해 일찌감치 사회적·경제적 안정을 이뤄나갔던 반면, 남한은 극도로 혼란스러웠다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: While North Korea achieved social and economic stability early through the rapid construction of systems, South Korea was still in a state of extreme confusion.

sentences.src_sentence: 북한에서는 시비의 여지없이 사회주주의 체제 구축이 처음부터 정해진 노선이었던 반면, 남한은 수많은 정당이 자유롭게 생겨나면서 이념적으로 좌파와 우파로 갈라져 치열하게 대립했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In North Korea, without question, the establishment of a social shareholder system was a fixed line from the beginning, while South Korea was ideologically divided into leftists and rightists as numerous political parties emerged freely, resulting in fierce confrontation.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방이 되고 나서 제대로 된 나라를 세우기까지의 혼란은 상상을 초월하는 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The chaos from liberation to establishing a proper country was beyond anyone’s imagination.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본의 식민지에서 벗어나 나라를 찾았다고 모두가 환호했으나 정작 나라 경제는 말이 아니었고, 북한은 남한을 한동안 압도해 나갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Everyone cheered that they had escaped from Japanese colonization and had their country back, but the country's economy was a mess, and North Korea overpowered South Korea for a while.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군의 통치, 자본주의 배를 타다 우리의 힘과 노력으로 일본 식민지 통치에서 해방됐다면 떳떳하고 당당했을 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Koreans would have been proud and confident if they had been liberated from Japanese colonial rule through their own strength and efforts after living under US military rule and capitalism.

sentences.src_sentence: 그렇지 못했기에 북한에는 소련 군대가, 남한에는 미국 군대가 들어섰다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Because they could not, Soviet troops entered North Korea and American troops entered South Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 이것이 장차 남북한의 운명을 달리하게 되는 두 갈래 역사의 시발점이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This was the starting point of a two-pronged history that would change the fate of the two Koreas in the future.

sentences.src_sentence: 북한은 소련이 주도하는 사회주의라는 배에, 남한은 미국이 주도하는 자본주의라는 배를 탄 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: North Korea followed the trend of socialism led by the Soviet Union, while South Korea followed the trend of capitalism led by the United States.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한을 다스리는 미군정청도 초기에는 혼란 속에서 시행착오가 많았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The US military government, which had governed South Korea, faced many trials and errors in the early stages of chaos.

sentences.src_sentence: 북한과 뚜렷이 대비되는 점은 사유재산권이 보장되는 시장경제를 만들어 나간다는 점이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: What contrasted sharply with North Korea was that it was creating a market economy in which private property rights were guaranteed.

sentences.src_sentence: 공산화 세력에 단호하게 대처하고 자본주의 체제를 만들어 나가겠다는 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The idea was to firmly handle the communist forces and create a capitalist system.

sentences.src_sentence: 한마디로 말해 스스로의 힘으로 나라를 세우고 끌어갈 자립 능력이 없다고 봤다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In a word, they thought that they did not have the self-reliance to establish and lead the country on their own.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국과 소련, 두 나라가 자기네끼리 모여서 신탁통치를 합의했던 것이 바로 그 증거다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The proof of this is that the two countries, the United States and the Soviet Union, came together and agreed to a trusteeship without the Koreas knowing.

sentences.src_sentence: 대한민국이 건국하는 과정은 외부의 도움, 즉 미국의 개입이 결정적 역할을 했음을 부인할 수 없다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It cannot be denied that external help, namely intervention by the United States, played a decisive role in the process of establishing South Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 식민지 지배에서 해방되긴 했어도 당시 조선 사람에게는 나라를 독자적으로 운영할 자금과 제도가 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even though they were liberated from colonial rule, the Joseon (Korean) people at the time did not have the funds or systems to independently manage their country.

sentences.src_sentence: 세금 걷는 제도부터 시작해 예산을 짜는 기술에 이르기까지 거의 모든 국정이 미국의 지시와 감독으로 진행됐고, 필요한 돈도 미국의 원조로 충당해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Almost all state affairs, from the tax collection system to budgeting techniques, were carried out under the direction and supervision of the United States, and the funds needed had to be fulfilled with aid from the United States.

sentences.src_sentence: 당시에는 국민이 내는 세금이라는 개념조차 제대로 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Back then, there was no concept of a tax paid by the people.

sentences.src_sentence: 1946년에 세금으로 걷은 돈은 나라 예산의 5~6%에 불과했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Tax revenue made up only 5-6% of the nation's budget in 1946.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정 3년간의 무상원조가 무려 5억 2,000만 달러에 달했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The US military government's grant aid for three years amounted to a crazy $520 million.

sentences.src_sentence: 나라의 금고가 비었으니 필요한 자금은 원조 받는 돈과 중앙은행에서 종이돈을 찍어내는 것으로 충당해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As the country's vaults were empty, the necessary funds had to be met with aid money and paper money printed by the central bank.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정청은 돈줄을 쥐고 있을 뿐만 아니라, 경제 제도를 만들어 나가는 데도 주도권을 행사했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The US Military Government not only held the money line, but also exercised initiative in creating the economic system itself.

sentences.src_sentence: 쌀을 자유롭게 시장에서 사고팔 수 있는 ‘미곡거래시장’을 개설했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The “Rice Trading Market” was opened where rice could be freely bought and sold in the market.

sentences.src_sentence: 정부가 일정한 값으로 배급해 주던 쌀을 시장기능에 맡겨 거래토록 하겠다는 취지였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The intention was to entrust the market function with rice, which the government distributed at a fixed price, to be traded.

sentences.src_sentence: 실정을 감안하지 않은 시도는 매점매석으로 이어졌고, 결국 한 달을 견디지 못하고 다시 배급체제로 되돌아갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Attempts that did not take into account the real situation led to cornering and selling, and the system eventually returned to the rationing system without lasting a month.

sentences.src_sentence: 이러한 시도는 비록 실패했으나 당시로써는 매우 파격적인 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Although this attempt failed, it was very unconventional at the time.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한 내의 극렬한 좌우 갈등 수습이 최대 골칫거리였던 미군정청은 경제보다는 정치적 혼란을 수습하는 일에 더 신경을 썼다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The U.S. Military Government, whose biggest issue was dealing with the fierce left-right conflict in South Korea, was more concerned with resolving political chaos than resolving the economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국 정부의 초기 입장은 남북한이 적당히 타협해서 단일 정부를 세우도록 하는 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The initial position of the US government was to allow the two Koreas to properly compromise and establish one government.

sentences.src_sentence: 얼마 안 가서 좌익 척결로 입장을 바꾸고 남로당 조직을 비롯한 남한 내의 공산화 세력을 강력히 단속해 나갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was not long before they changed their stance to eradicating leftists, and they vigorously cracked down on communist forces in South Korea, including the South Korean Workers' Party.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정청이 이처럼 남한 내 공산화 시도를 철저히 봉쇄했던 것이 남한으로 하여금 사유재산권을 보장하는 시장경제 체제를 구축해 나가는 데 결정적인 역할을 했던 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The U.S. Military Government's thorough blockade of attempts at communism taking root in South Korea played a decisive role in establishing a market economy system that guaranteed private property rights in South Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 사람과 기술, 그리고 경영 자체가 하루아침에 없어져 버렸으니 경제는 마비될 수밖에 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: People, technology, and management itself disappeared overnight, so the economy had no choice but to halt.

sentences.src_sentence: 은행도 일본인들이 철수하면서 예금을 빼가는 바람에 쑥대밭이 됐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Banks also fell into disrepair as the Japanese withdrew their deposits when they withdrew.

sentences.src_sentence: 남북이 갈라지는 바람에 기업 활동은 더욱 위축됐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As the two Koreas split, business activities further shrank.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국 점령군은 임시 정부 노릇을 하면서 새로운 판을 짜기 시작했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The U.S. occupation forces began to create new strategies while acting as the provisional government.

sentences.src_sentence: 대표적인 두 가지 돈벌이는 ‘적산기업 인수’와 ‘구호물자 사업’이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The two representative sources of money were “acquisition of hostile companies” and “relief goods business”.

sentences.src_sentence: 으뜸가는 사업은 일본인으로부터 몰수한 재산, 이른바 적산 재산을 재주껏 손에 넣는 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The foremost business was to acquire the property confiscated from the Japanese, what was called accumulated property.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본인 소유의 농지가 전체 남한 농지의 11% 정도 됐는데, 미군정청이 나서서 소작 농민을 중심으로 새롭게 땅 주인을 만들어 줬다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Japanese-owned farmland accounted for approximately 11% of all farmland in South Korea, and the US Military Government stepped in and created new land owners, mainly tenant farmers.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본인이 살던 집은 적산 관리위원회를 구성해서 경매처분을 통해 큰 말썽 없이 매듭을 지었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The houses where Japanese people lived were settled without much trouble by organizing a property management committee and auctioning them off.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본인이 경영하던 적산기업 수는 크고 작은 것을 합쳐서 2,700여 개에 달했는데, 수많은 사람이 이것들을 차지하려고 미군정청을 상대로 수단과 방법을 가리지 않고 치열한 로비를 벌였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The number of large and small companies run by Japanese reached about 2,700, and numerous people lobbied fiercely against the US Military Government to acquire these, regardless of the means and methods of doing so.

sentences.src_sentence: 철수한 일본인 기업주와 내통해서 사실상 주인 행세를 하는 경우도 적지 않았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There were a fair amount of cases in which they acted as de facto owners by colluding with the Japanese business owners who had withdrawn.

sentences.src_sentence: 북한에서는 소련 고문단의 코치 아래 모든 기업의 국유화 조치가 일찌감치 취해졌고, 남한에서도 주요 산업의 국유화를 주장하는 목소리가 높았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In North Korea, under the guidance of Soviet advisers, nationalization of all companies was taken early, while in South Korea, voices calling for the nationalization of key industries were also strong.

sentences.src_sentence: 자본주의 경제에서 기업은 민간이 중심이 되어야 한다는 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In a capitalist economy, businesses should be the focus in the private sector.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정청은 기업 활동의 활성화라는 명분을 내세워 적산기업의 일부만 민간에게 넘기고, 대부분의 주요 기업들은 중간관리인만 지정한 채 의도적으로 시간을 끌었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Under the pretext of revitalizing business activities, the US military government handed over only part of the accumulated companies to the private sector, and most major companies deliberately delayed things by designating only middle managers.

sentences.src_sentence: 골치 아픈 적산기업 처리를 자기들이 처리하지 않고 새로 수립되는 한국 정부에 넘기기로 한 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Instead of dealing with the troublesome hostile companies, they decided to hand it over to the newly established Korean government.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정청이 적산기업의 처리 원칙을 국유화가 아닌 민영화로 정한 것이 남한 기업 역사의 시작이었던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The US Military Government's decision to treat hostile companies as privatization, not nationalization, was the beginning of the history of South Korean companies.

sentences.src_sentence: 적산 기업 못지않은 또 다른 돈벌이는 미국이 주는 원조물자, 구호물자를 확보하는 일이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Another way to make money, as much as hostile companies, was to secure aid and relief supplies from the United States.

sentences.src_sentence: 밀가루·의류·의약품 등 생필품이 중심이었고, 기름·석탄·비료·면화 등 원료도 대상이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Daily necessities such as flour, clothes, and medicine were the focus, and raw materials such as oil, coal, fertilizer, and cotton were also targeted.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정청은 본국에서 보내오는 구호물자를 제대로 나눠주는 것이 큰 과제였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: For the US Military Government, it was a big task to properly distribute relief supplies sent from their home country.

sentences.src_sentence: 무정부시대나 다름없는 해방 직후의 혼란과 부패 속에 구호물자들이 필요한 곳에 제대로 돌아갈 리 만무했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In the midst of chaos and corruption immediately after liberation, which was comparable to the era of anarchy, there was no way that relief supplies would properly go to where they were needed.

sentences.src_sentence: 상당 부분이 암시장으로 흘러들어 갔고, 이것을 통해 막대한 돈을 번 사람을 ‘구호물자 벼락부자’라고 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: A large portion of it flowed into the black market, and people who made a huge amount of money through this were called "relief goods rich".

sentences.src_sentence: 미국은 여러 시도 끝에 구호물자를 교회 같은 종교단체를 통해 배급하기도 했는데, 이즈음에 교회가 급격히 난립했던 배경에는 이처럼 무상으로 배급되는 구호물자 탓도 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: After several attempts, the United States distributed relief supplies through religious organizations such as churches, but the rapid proliferation of churches around this time was also due to the free distribution of relief supplies.

sentences.src_sentence: 당시 일본을 통치했던 맥아더 사령부는 일본의 무역 행위 자체를 금지시켰으나 사실상 단속이 불가능했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The MacArthur rule, which ruled over Japan at the time, banned any trade by Japan itself, but it was virtually impossible to crack down on this.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본 상인들은 부족한 쌀을 한국으로부터 밀수입했고, 한국 쪽에서는 부산항을 통해 일제 화장품, 의약품, 기계부품 등을 물물교환으로 들여왔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Japanese merchants smuggled the rice that was so scarce for them from Korea, while the Korean side brought in Japanese cosmetics, medicines, and machine parts through trade through the Port of Busan.

sentences.src_sentence: 일본과의 밀무역에 이어 다롄, 칭다오 등 중국과의 무역도 성행했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Following the smuggling trade with Japan, trade with cities in China such as Dalian and Qingdao also flourished.

sentences.src_sentence: 1947년 3월쯤부터는 마카오를 통한 중계무역이, 그리고 뒤이어 홍콩과의 무역이 본격화되기 시작했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: From around March 1947, transit trade through Macau, followed by trade with Hong Kong, began.

sentences.src_sentence: 우리는 적산기업들이 생산했던 텅스텐·망간 등을 수출했고, 그 돈으로 페니실린·사카린·시계·생고무 등을 수입했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Our country exported tungsten and manganese produced by hostile companies, and with that money, imported penicillin, saccharin, watches, and raw rubber.

sentences.src_sentence: 무역이 돈벌이의 주축으로 활기를 띠자, 해방 이전부터 무역업을 했던 화신무역의 박흥식이 선두에 나섰고 다른 조선인 기업들도 뒤따랐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As trade became the major axis of money-making, Park Heung-sik of Hwashin Trading, which had been trading since before liberation, took the lead, and other Korean companies followed him.

sentences.src_sentence: 대구에서 양조장을 하던 이병철도 1948년 서울에 삼성물산공사를 설립하고 무역업에 뛰어들었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In 1948, Lee Byeong-cheol, who had a brewery in Daegu, established Samsung C&T Corporation in Seoul and entered the trading business.

sentences.src_sentence: 남북이 갈라진 다음에도 양쪽 간의 교역은 한동안 계속되어 북한은 비료·수산물 등을, 남한은 쌀·면사 등을 물물 교환했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even after the split between the two Koreas, trade between the two sides continued for a while, with North Korea trading fertilizers and marine products, and South Korea trading rice and cotton yarn.

sentences.src_sentence: 1948년 6월에는 화신무역이 면사·생고무 등을 배에 싣고 북한의 원산항을 거쳐 흥남 질소 공장의 비료를 싣고 올 예정이었으나 배는 끝내 돌아오지 않기도 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In June 1948, Hwashin Trading was scheduled to load cotton yarn and raw rubber onto their ship and load fertilizer from the Heungnam Nitrogen Factory via Wonsan Port in North Korea, but that ship never returned.

sentences.src_sentence: 일제 강점기에는 조선인이 경영하는 기업다운 기업을 찾아보기 힘들었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: During the Japanese colonial period, it was difficult to find companies that were run by Koreans.

sentences.src_sentence: 자본과 기술 등 기업이 갖춰야 할 것들은 일본인이 장악하고 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The Japanese were in control of what companies needed to be equipped with to operate, such as capital and technology.

sentences.src_sentence: 비율로 보면 조선인이 소유한 기업은 전체 기업 중 1/10 정도였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In terms of ratios, the number of companies owned by Koreans was about 1/10 of all companies.

sentences.src_sentence: 그나마도 쌀을 빻는 정미소나 술 담그는 양조장이 고작이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even so, there were only rice mills that ground rice or breweries that made alcohol.

sentences.src_sentence: 그런 가운데 호남의 대표적인 지주였던 김연수가 1919년에 경성방직을 설립해 만주시장까지 진출했고, ‘조선의 유통왕’으로 불렸던 박흥식이 인쇄업과 종이장사로 시작해 1931년에 화신백화점을 차려 주목받았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In the meantime, Kim Yeon-soo, a big landowner in Honam, established Gyeongseong Textile in 1919 and entered the Manchurian market while Park Heung-shik, who was called "the Joseon king of distribution," started a printing business and a paper trade and opened Hwashin Department Store in 1931, drawing attention.

sentences.src_sentence: 건국 대통령, 이승만 시대 돈 없는 정부 1948년 8월 15일, 해방된 지 꼭 3년 만에 정부가 탄생했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Founding President Syngman Rhee’s era, a government without money On August 15, 1948, exactly three years after liberation, a government was founded.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정 시대 3년을 거쳐 비로소 초대 대통령 이승만이 이끄는 대한민국 정부가 들어선 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: After three years of the US military government era, the government of the Republic of Korea, led by the first president Syngman Rhee, came into existence.

sentences.src_sentence: 당시는 워낙 헐벗고 굶주림이 심했기에 지금의 기준으로 따지는 것은 무리다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: At the time, it was unreasonable to judge this government by today's standards because the country was so naked and starved.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제성장률이 몇 %였는가 등을 정확히 계산해 내는 것은 불가능했고 의미도 없는 일이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was impossible and meaningless to calculate exactly what % the economic growth rate was.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만 시대 12년 동안 그런 상황이 내내 지속되었다고 해도 과언이 아니다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It is no exaggeration to say that such a situation continued throughout the 12 years of the Syngman Rhee era.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방 이후의 혼란에 이어 건국한 지 2년도 안돼서 6·25전쟁이 터졌고, 3년여의 전쟁 통에 경제가 폐허가 됐으니 무엇 하나 제대로 측정할 수도 없는 형편이었던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Following the chaos after liberation, the Korean War broke out less than two years after the founding of the country, and as the economy was in ruins during the three years of war, it was impossible to properly measure anything.

sentences.src_sentence: 돈이 없는 정부가 정상적인 행정을 펴 나갈 수 없는 건 불 보듯 뻔한 일이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was obvious that a government that did not have money could not carry out normal administration.

sentences.src_sentence: 정부 관료는 해외출장 발령이 났는데도 출장비가 제때 나오지 않아 개인 돈을 써야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even though government officials were ordered to go on overseas business trips, travel expenses were not paid on time, so they had to spend their own money on them.

sentences.src_sentence: 국무총리실 직속 기획처 소속 이선희 사무관은 주요 계획 수립을 위해 대통령의 결재까지 받아 일본 출장 명령을 받았지만, 출장 전날까지 출장비가 나오지 않았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Lee Seon-hee, an official in the planning department directly under the Prime Minister's office, was ordered to travel to Japan after receiving approval from the president to establish a major plan, but travel expenses were not paid until the day before the business trip.

sentences.src_sentence: 그는 아내의 결혼반지와 시계를 팔아서 출장비 500달러를 마련해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: He had to sell his wife's wedding ring and watch to pay for the $500 trip.

sentences.src_sentence: 6·25전쟁 당시, 북한군과 전투 중이던 일선 부대장은 보급 물자가 떨어지자 한국은행 대구지점으로 달려가서 창구 직원에게 소총을 들이대고 돈을 내놓으라고 협박하는 사태도 벌어졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: During the Korean War, there was a situation in which a front-line unit commander fighting the North Korean army ran out of supplies, so ran to the Daegu branch of the Bank of Korea, pointed a rifle at the teller, and demanded that they hand over money.

sentences.src_sentence: 군 지휘관이 군자금 마련을 위해 은행 강도로 돌변한 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: A military commander had turned to bank robbery to raise military funds.

sentences.src_sentence: 한마디로 대한민국에 정부가 수립되었다고는 하지만, 꼴이 말이 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Basically, though a government was technically established in Korea, it was a mess.

sentences.src_sentence: 제대로 된 산업이 없고 경제가 엉망이니 세금 걷을 곳이 없었고, 세금을 못 걷으니 정부는 제 구실을 할 수가 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There was no proper industry and the economy was in a mess. There was no place to collect taxes, and the government was not able to do its job as it could not collect taxes.

sentences.src_sentence: 재정능력이 없는 신생 정부가 할 수 있는 정책은 돈을 찍어내는 것뿐이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The only policy that the new government can implement without financial ability is to print money.

sentences.src_sentence: 가뜩이나 해방 전부터 돈이 많이 풀려 있었고 물자는 부족한데, 정부가 돈을 마구 찍어내니 악성 인플레이션이 거듭되는 것은 당연했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Even before liberation, there was a lot of money being released and supplies were in short supply, but with the government printing money recklessly, it was only natural that malicious inflation continued.

sentences.src_sentence: 미군정 시대가 끝나고 정부가 수립되었지만, 여전히 미국 원조에 절대적으로 의존할 수밖에 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Although the era of the US Military Government was over and the government was established, it was still absolutely dependent on US aid.

sentences.src_sentence: 어떻게 해서라도 원조를 많이 받아내야 부족한 물자난을 해소하고 민심을 토닥일 수 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: No matter how much aid was received, the shortage of goods could be resolved and public sentiment could be soothed.

sentences.src_sentence: 달러 못지않게 절실한 것은 나라를 운영하는 노하우였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: What was as desperate as the dollar was the know-how to run a country.

sentences.src_sentence: 정부의 예산회계제도는 어떻게 만들고 운용해야 하는지, 금융통화 정책은 어떻게 꾸려가야 하는지 등 기본부터 익혀야 할 일들이 하나 둘이 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: There were a bucketful of things that needed to be learned from the basics, such as how to create and operate a government's budget accounting system and how to manage financial and monetary policies.

sentences.src_sentence: 어떤 것은 일본 규정을 그대로 베꼈고, 어떤 것은 미국 자문관이 시키는 대로 뜻도 제대로 모르는 채 따라 해야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Some of the Japanese rules were copied word for word, and sometimes the government had to follow the American advisors without even knowing what they were telling them to do.

sentences.src_sentence: 6·25전쟁이 끝난 이듬해인 1954년, 정부는 IMF에 가입하게 되는데 정부 안에 IMF가 무엇을 하는 곳인지를 제대로 아는 사람도 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In 1954, the year after the end of the Korean War, the government joined the IMF, but no one in the government really knew what the IMF actually was.

sentences.src_sentence: 수입대체산업에 앞장선 이승만 미국은 돈줄을 쥐고 있을 뿐 아니라, 한국경제의 진로를 정해 주고 정책을 어떻게 세우는지 일일이 가르쳤다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Syngman Rhee, who was at the forefront of the import substitution industry, not only held the money, but also set the course of the Korean economy and taught how to establish policies.

sentences.src_sentence: 당시 한국 정부는 미국 정부가 파견한 자문관, 또는 대외원조처 같은 원조기관의 경제전문가들의 영향력이 컸다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: At that time, the Korean government was heavily influenced by advisors dispatched by the US government and economic experts from aid agencies such as the Ministry of Foreign Aid.

sentences.src_sentence: 매년 경제 정책을 세울 때나 원조받은 자금을 쓰는 것도 이들의 조언에 따라야 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: They had to follow the advice of the advisors when setting up economic policies every year or using aid funds.

sentences.src_sentence: 1952년에 만들어진 ‘한미합동경제위원회’에서 주요 경제 정책들을 결정했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The Korea-U.S. Joint Economic Committee, established in 1952, made decisions on major economic policies.

sentences.src_sentence: 비록 공산당 경력이 있으나 농민들에게 인기 있었던 조봉암을 초대 농림부 장관에 발탁한 것도 토지개혁을 염두에 둔 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Cho Bong-am, who was a favorite among farmers despite his communist background was selected as the first Agriculture and Forestry Minister with land reform in mind.

sentences.src_sentence: 남한의 토지개혁은 농지만을 대상으로 했다는 점에서 정확하게는 농지개혁이라고 불러야 한다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The land reform in South Korea should be called farmland reform, since it was only aimed at farmland.

sentences.src_sentence: 농지개혁을 실시하고 나서 곧바로 전쟁이 터지는 바람에 한동안 중단되었다가 1957년에서야 작업을 마무리 지을 수 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: After implementing land reform, the war broke out and the reform was suspended for a while, only in 1957 was it possible to complete the reform.

sentences.src_sentence: 대한민국이 세워지고 농지개혁처럼 힘들고 부작용이 컸던 개혁 작업은 여태껏 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Never before has there been a reform that was as challenging and devastating as land reform after the establishment of the Republic of Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 실시과정에서 부정부패가 많았고, 공정하게 집행되지 못한 측면도 적지 않았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: In the implementation process there was a lot of corruption, and there were many aspects that were not carried out fairly.

sentences.src_sentence: 6·25전쟁이 터지기 불과 3개월 전에 토지개혁을 실시한 것은 천만다행이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Only three months before the Korean War broke out, the land reform was a disaster.

sentences.src_sentence: 내용을 따지기 전에 만약 농지개혁 없이 전쟁을 맞았다면 남한은 순식간에 북한의 수중에 들어갔을 것이 뻔했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Before considering the contents, it was obvious that South Korea would have fallen into the hands of North Korea in an instant if it did not have land reform policies.

sentences.src_sentence: 아마 땅을 거저 나눠 주는 북한 점령군에 대해 남한 농민들은 적극적으로 지지했을 터이고, 전쟁은 북한의 조기 승리로 끝났을 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Maybe the South Korean farmers would have actively supported the North Korean occupation, which handed out land for free and leading to an early victory for North Korea.

sentences.src_sentence: 농지개혁의 정치적·정책적 의도가 무엇이었든 간에 그 결과와 역사적 의미는 실로 대단했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Regardless of the political intentions and policy of land reform, it resulted in success and historical significance.

sentences.src_sentence: 비록 땅값을 치른 ‘유상몰수’였다고는 하나, 왕조 시대의 전통적 지주제도가 농지개혁으로 인해 일시에 해체된 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was said to have been a paid confiscation, but the traditional landlord system from the dynasty period was temporarily dismantled because of land reform.

sentences.src_sentence: 부작용도 상당했지만 지주제도의 해체는 한국경제의 생산구조와 분배구조 면에서 혁신적 변화를 몰고 왔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Despite the significant side effects, the dismantling of the landlord system brought about innovative changes in the production and distribution structure of the Korean economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 지주제도의 붕괴는 3년간의 처참한 전쟁을 치러내는 과정에서 더 과격하게 진행됐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: During the course of three years of disastrous war, there was a radical collapse of the landlord system.

sentences.src_sentence: 전쟁 통에 지주계급들은 피해가 컸을 뿐만 아니라, 극심한 전쟁 인플레이션 탓에 토지보상대금으로 받은 지가증권이 휴짓조각으로 되었기 때문이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Not only did the landowners suffer a lot during the war, but due to extreme war inflation, the land securities they received as compensation for land were scrapped.

sentences.src_sentence: 농지개혁을 계기로 기존의 농업자본이 산업자본으로 전환되는 것을 기대했었으나, 애초의 의도는 완전히 물거품이 되고 말았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The existing agricultural capital was expected to be converted into industrial capital in the wake of the land reform, but the original intention was ruined.

sentences.src_sentence: 지주들이 유상몰수의 대가로 받은 지가증권은 3년 전쟁을 치르면서 엿장수들이 엿을 주고 거둬들일 정도로 그 가치가 폭락했던 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Land securities which the landlords received for paid confiscation dropped in value to the point the mistresses gave and collected them that during the Three Years' War.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만은 농지개혁을 실시함으로써 공산화를 막았고, 자본주의 기틀인 사유재산제도를 공고히 다졌으며, 지주계급이 해체됨에 따라 분배구조면에서도 꾸준한 진전을 이룰 수 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: By dismantling the landlord class, Syngman Rhee, was able to make steady progress in terms of land distribution, thus preventing communism and solidifying the private property system, which is the foundation of capitalism.

sentences.src_sentence: 이것이 브라질이나 아르헨티나 필리핀 경제와 근본적으로 다른 점이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: This method differs drastically from the Brazilian or Argentinean and Philippine economies.

sentences.src_sentence: 브라질의 대통령인 룰라가 재임 시절에 “브라질 경제의 근본 문제는 한국이 1950년대에 했던 농지개혁을 아직도 못하고 있기 때문”이라고 한 말은 한국의 농지개혁을 밖에서 보는 객관적인 평가기도 하다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Lula, the president of Brazil, said “The fundamental problem of Brazil’s economy is that Korea has not yet been able to reform its farmland in the 1950s”, which is an objective assessment of Korea’s farmland reform from an outside perspective.

sentences.src_sentence: 무상원조를 많이 받았지만, 전쟁의 파괴 속에서 남아나는 것은 아무것도 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Much of the aid was received, but nothing survived the war.

sentences.src_sentence: 1953년에 비로소 전쟁이 끝나고 나서야 한국 경제는 정신을 차리기 시작했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It was not until the war ended in 1953 that the Korean economy came to its senses.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국의 원조도 전쟁 복구와 부흥에 초점이 맞춰졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Aid from the U. S. was also focused on restoring and reviving after the war.

sentences.src_sentence: 그러한 노력의 결과로 1953~1961년 사이의 연평균 제조업 성장률은 11.5%를 기록했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Because of those efforts the average annual manufacturing growth rate was 11.5% between the years of 1953 and 1961.

sentences.src_sentence: 주로 제분 공장, 설탕 공장, 옷감 공장 등 생필품을 생산하는 공장이 지어졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Mainly factories were built to produce daily necessities such as milling plants, sugar factories and textile factories.

sentences.src_sentence: 공장 시설은 일본이 남기고 간 적산기업을 불하받은 것을 사용하고, 원료는 미국에서 원조받은 밀, 설탕원료, 솜 등으로 조달했으며, 기업자금은 미국에서 주는 원조 자금으로 충당했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The factory facilities used what Japan had left behind and the raw materials were soured from U.S. funded wheat, sugar, and cotton, and corporate funds were financed by U.S. aid funds.

sentences.src_sentence: 사람은 일본인 회사에 몸담은 경험이 있거나 연줄을 맺었던 사람들이 주도권을 잡았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The initiative was taken by people who had experience working with Japanese companies or had previous connections with them.

sentences.src_sentence: 혼란 속에서도 전쟁이 끝나고 3~4년 동안은 제법 기업 활동이 왕성했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Despite the turmoil, business activities were quite brisk for three or four years after the war ended.

sentences.src_sentence: 1957년 즈음에는 면방·제분업 분야에 투자가 몰려서 과잉생산 문제가 생겨나기도 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Around 1957, investment in the cotton spinning and milling industries was concentrated which resulted in overproduction problems.

sentences.src_sentence: 가장 돈벌이가 잘됐던 사업은 전쟁의 파괴가 빚어낸 고철 장사였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: All of the destruction caused by the war resulted in the scrap metal trade becoming the most profitable business.

sentences.src_sentence: 탄피와 고철더미를 수집해서 일본에 파는 것이 중요한 외화벌이였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: An important source of foreign currency was gathering scrap metal and selling it to Japan.

sentences.src_sentence: 기업들은 이익이 나는 사업이면 수단 방법을 가리지 않았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Companies resorted to profitable businesses.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만 정권하에서 빚어진 각종 특혜 환경이나 정부 정책이야 말로 기업으로서는 사업을 성공시킬 수 있는 절호의 이윤동기이자 기회였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The different preferential circumstances and government policies created under the Syngman Rhee government were the golden motivation and opportunity for companies to succeed as business.

sentences.src_sentence: 적산기업을 누구에게 불하하느냐, 환율이나 금리 정책을 어떻게 하느냐, 제한된 원조 자금을 어떤 기업에게 지원하느냐, 수입 규제를 어디까지 하느냐에 따라 기업의 흥망성쇠가 엇갈렸다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The rise and fall of companies varied depending on who they sold the integrated companies to, how they conducted exchange rate or interest policies, which companies had limited aid funds, and how far imports were regulated.

sentences.src_sentence: 정부 정책 자체가 하루아침에 벼락부자를 만들어 내는 특혜 생산 공장이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: An overnight rush of wealth was created by the government’s policy which was a preferential production plant.

sentences.src_sentence: 정치와 기업 사이의 유착이 만연할 수밖에 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: At this time fusion between politics and business was unavoidable.

sentences.src_sentence: 정권에 줄을 잘 잡은 기업은 하루아침에 벼락부자가 됐고, 미운털이 박히면 나락으로 떨어졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Companies that were well aligned with the government become rich in a single day, and failed if they were caught in a scandal.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만 정권과 자유당은 거액의 정치자금을 기업들로부터 챙겼고, 이 돈으로 야당의 정치적 라이벌을 압도할 수 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When the Syngman Rhee administration and the Liberal Party pocketed large sums of political funds from companies, they crushed the opposition parties.

sentences.src_sentence: 김구를 도왔던 금광부자 최창학은 김구가 암살된 후 재계에서 사라졌고, 이승만을 도왔던 백낙승은 태창그룹을 일구어 크게 번창했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: For example, Choi Chang-hak, a successful gold miner who had helped Kim Koo, disappeared from the business world after Kim Goo’s assassination, while Baek Nak-seung, who helped Syngman Rhee, prospered greatly by establishing the Taechang Group.

sentences.src_sentence: 이 시대의 모든 기업 활동을 정경유착의 시각으로만 해석할 순 없다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: However, not all corporate activities in this era can be interpreted only from an economic perspective.

sentences.src_sentence: 부정부패는 당시 사회의 일반적 풍토이자 수준이기도 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Corruption was also common in society at the time.

sentences.src_sentence: 비록 이승만 정권이 부정부패 정권의 표본으로 비난 받아 마땅하지만, 이승만 개인은 청렴했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Syngman Rhee was honest, despite the fact that his government was a model of corruption.

sentences.src_sentence: 정부와 기업 활동의 구별도 모호해 국가 기반시설 확충이나 산업을 담당하는 국영기업체들이 여기저기 만들어졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Since there was almost no distinction between government and corporate activities, state-owned enterprises in charge of expanding national infrastructure or industries were created here and there.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만은 에너지 문제를 해결하기 위해 대한석탄공사를 설립했는데, 초대 총재에 교통부 장관 허정을 겸임 발령했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Korea Coal Corporation was founded to solve the energy problem by Syngman Rhee, and he appointed Heo Jeong-eul, the Minister of Transportation as the president.

sentences.src_sentence: 새로 만든 국영기업의 첫 CEO 자리를 현직 장관이 겸하도록 한 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: An incumbent minister was appointed as the first CEO of a new state-run company.

sentences.src_sentence: 나중에 경영이 엉망이 되자 민간 기업인 강원 탄광 사장 정인욱을 불러들여 경영 혁신을 맡겼다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When the management became a mess, he turned to Jeong In-wook, the president of the Gangwon Coal Mine, a private company, and tasked him with management innovation.

sentences.src_sentence: 일체의 정치적 간섭을 하지 않겠다는 다짐을 대통령으로부터 받아낸 정인욱은 적자 기업을 단숨에 흑자 기업으로 바꿔 놓았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Jung In-wook, turned a deficit company into a surplus company at once, after the president promised not to interfere in any political way.

sentences.src_sentence: 특혜시비와 부정부패 속에서도 산업의 새싹은 돋아나고 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: the industry was booming despite in the special treatment and corruption.

sentences.src_sentence: 설탕 공장과 방직 공장에 이어 유리 공장과 시멘트 공장이 지어졌고, 석탄을 실어 나르는 철도가 놓이면서 화력발전소도 세워졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: A sugar factory and a textile factory followed, a glass factory and a cement factory built, a coal-fired railroad was laid, and a thermal power plant was built.

sentences.src_sentence: 전반적인 경제상황은 미국이 주던 무상원조가 줄어들면서 급속히 나빠졌다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Overall, the economic situation became worse rapidly as funds from the United States declined.

sentences.src_sentence: 기업들은 졸지에 이자와 환율 부담까지 겹치는 바람에 1959~1960년 사이 심각한 불황 속에 빠져들었고, 이처럼 경제가 악화된 상황에서 이승만 정권은 부정선거 끝에 붕괴를 맞이했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Companies fell into a dire recession between 1959 and 1960 due to overlapping interest and exchange rate burdens and with the economy failing, the Rhee Syngman regime collapsed after fraudulent elections.

sentences.src_sentence: 아마도 대통령 이승만과 그의 부인 프란체스카였을 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Maybe it was President Syngman Rhee and his wife Francesca.

sentences.src_sentence: 이승만은 청년 시절 배재학당에서 영어 선생을 했을 뿐 아니라, 33년간 미국에 살았고, 저명한 대학에서 정치학 박사까지 했으니 원어민 못지않은 능통한 영어를 구사했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Syngman Rhee worked as an English teacher at Pai Chai Hakdang as a young man, he lived in the United States for 33 years, and received a doctorate in political science at a prestigious university, thus he spoke English as fluent as a native speaker.

sentences.src_sentence: ‘필요하면 통역을 쓰면 되는데.’라고 말할 수도 있다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: You might say, 'You can use an interpreter if you need to'.

sentences.src_sentence: 대통령의 영어실력이 출중했다는 것은 단순한 언어 소통 차원의 문제가 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The president's great proficiency in the English language was not just a matter of language communication.

sentences.src_sentence: 대통령 이승만의 능통한 영어는 불안한 건국 초기의 나라 운영 전반에 걸쳐 상당한 영향을 미쳤다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: President Syngman Rhee's English fluency had a great impact on the overall operation of the country during the unstable early period when founding of the country.

sentences.src_sentence: 해방 이후 미국과 소련의 이해관계에 따라 한반도 정책이 좌지우지되고 있던 판에 한국 최고지도자의 외국어 소통 능력이나 국제적 안목, 그리고 인적 네트워크 여부는 매우 중요했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: After Korea was freed, the Korean Peninsula policy was overwhelmed by the interests of the US and the Soviet Union while the Korean supreme leader's ability to communicate in a foreign language, international perspective, and personal network proved to be very important.

sentences.src_sentence: 대통령이 영어를 능숙하게 구사했다는 것은 소통 능력 뿐 아니라 사고방식이나 교제범위가 그만큼 국제적이었음을 말해 주는 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The president’s English fluency shows not only his communication skills, but also that his way of thinking and the scope of his fellowship were international.

sentences.src_sentence: 미국은 한국 초대 대통령의 능통한 영어가 편하기도 했지만 때로는 불편하기 짝이 없었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The United States was comfortable with the English fluency of the first president of Korea, but at times it was also uncomfortable.

sentences.src_sentence: 한국 대통령과 언어 소통이 잘못되는 일은 전혀 걱정하지 않았지만, 미국의 주장에 한마디도 물러서지 않고 맞설 때는 여간 골칫거리가 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: I never worried about the miscommunication with the Korean president, but it was a headache when I did not back down and confronted the US.

sentences.src_sentence: 만약 이승만에게 거침없는 영어 소통 능력이 없었다면 한국은 미국에 대해 훨씬 고분고분했을 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: If Syngman Rhee couldn’t communicate fluently in English, Korea would have been much more compliant with the United States.

sentences.tgt_sentence: It continued for a whopping 35 years in seven rounds, starting with the first five-year economic development plan in 1961, and came to an end under the Kim Young-sam government.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제개발 5개년계획은 한국의 경제개발 정책이 그동안 정부 주도 경제였음을 단적으로 말해 주는 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When analyzing the five-year economic development plan it becomes clear that Korea's economic development policy has been a government-led economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 박정희의 5개년계획은 북한을 포함한 사회주의 국가들의 계획경제와는 전혀 달랐다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Compared to planned economies of socialist countries, including North Korea, Park Chung-hee's five-year plan was completely different. .

sentences.src_sentence: 정부가 계획을 세워놓고서 모든 것을 거기에 끼워 맞추는 것이 아니라, 필요에 따라 5개년계획을 수시로 뜯어고치면서 탄력적으로 운영했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The five-year plan was frequently revised and operated flexibly as needed, instead of having the government set up a plan and fitting everything into it.

sentences.src_sentence: 군사정권 초기, 정권을 잡은 군인들은 경제를 몰랐기 때문에 오히려 계획 달성에 매달렸다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The soldiers who came to power, in the early days of the military regime, did not know the economy, so they clung to the success of the plan.

sentences.src_sentence: “국민에게 약속한 5개년계획을 제대로 실천해야 한다.”라는 일종의 강박 관념이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: It became a type of fixation, saying, “The five-year plan promised to the people must be properly implemented”.

sentences.src_sentence: 제2차 경제개발 5개년계획부터는 체계적으로 계획을 세웠고, 상황 따라 융통성 있게 운용해 나갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The plan was systematically planned and managed flexibly according to the circumstances from the 2nd Five-Year Economic Development Plan.

sentences.src_sentence: 5개년계획을 만드는 경제기획원은 예산권도 함께 갖고 있었으므로 계획과 예산지원을 적절히 조정하면서 경제 운용의 뼈대를 효과적으로 유지할 수 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The EPB, responsible for the five-year plan, could effectively maintain the framework of economic operation while properly adjusting the plan and budget support, because they had the budgetary authority.

sentences.src_sentence: 세계 어느 나라에서도 예를 찾아볼 수 없는 한국 특유의 ‘계획 경제’를 만들어 나갔던 것이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The result was a 'planned economy' exclusive to Korea, therefore, it can’t be found in any other country in the world.

sentences.src_sentence: 5개년계획을 세우려면 실무관료들이 2년 동안 총동원되어 대통령 결재로 확정되는 것인데, 대통령이 생각지도 않았던 대형 프로젝트를 불쑥불쑥 터뜨리는 바람에 계획 전체를 수정해야 하는 일이 한두 번이 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Working-level officials are mobilized for two years and approved by the president in order to establish a five-year plan, but it wasn't once or twice that the entire plan had to be revised because the president suddenly exploded a large project he hadn't thought of.

sentences.src_sentence: 경부고속도로나 포항제철소 건설 같은 거대한 국책 사업은 애당초 제2차 경제개발 5개년계획에 들어 있지 않았다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The 2nd Five-Year Economic Development Plan in the first place did not include big national projects such as the construction of Gyeongbu Expressway and Pohang Works.

sentences.src_sentence: 계획과는 별도로 박정희의 구상에 따라 갑자기 추가된 케이스였다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Apart from the plan, it was a situation that was suddenly added according to Park Chung-hee's idea.

sentences.src_sentence: 어떤 계획이든 예산의 뒷받침이 있어야 하는데, 대통령의 이 같은 돌발적인 발상과 과감한 정책 추진 탓에 실무관료들은 애를 먹었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The president's sudden idea and bold policy implementation made it difficult for working-level officials, however, any plan had to be supported by a budget. .

sentences.src_sentence: 가장 심하게 혼선을 빚은 것은 중화학공업 육성이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The promotion of the heavy and chemical industry caused the most confusion.

sentences.src_sentence: 돈이 한두 푼 드는 것도 아닌데, 특별 담화를 통해 갑자기 발표하는 바람에 기존의 제3차 경제개발 5개년계획은 체면이 말이 아니었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Because it was suddenly announced through a special discourse, the existing 3rd Five-Year Economic Development Plan was not worth the effort, regardless of the cost.

sentences.tgt_sentence: At the end of the year, exports of $10 billion, income of $100, 000' was not in the original target, but was added through revision work.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제개발 5개년계획을 만들도록 지시한 장본인이었던 동시에, 계획에 구애받지 않고 거대한 사업들을 임의로 벌였던 주역 또한 박정희였던 셈이다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Park Chung-hee carried out huge projects arbitrarily regardless of the plan, he was the one who ordered the creation of the five-year economic development plan.

sentences.src_sentence: 땜질을 많이 했지만 5년을 주기로 범정부적인 목표와 계획을 수립하고 이를 추진하는 것 자체가 경제개발이 국정 우선순위의 첫째임을 분명히 하는 것이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Although I had a lot to learn, it became obvious that the first priority of the government was economic development by establishing and implementing pan-government goals and plans every five years.

sentences.src_sentence: 계획이 거창하면 실천이 못 따라가는 것이 보통인데, 박정희 시대의 경제개발 5개년계획은 번번이 초과달성과 조기달성을 거듭했었고, 그럴 때마다 계획을 상향 조정하곤 했다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: When the plan is too large, it is usually impossible to follow the execution. Surprisingly,  Park Chung-hee’s five-year economic development repeatedly exceeded and achieved early achievements, and each time the plan was adjusted upward.

sentences.src_sentence: 그 배경에는 박정희의 리더십, 공무원들의 열정 그리고 더러는 실적주의에 따른 졸속과 날림도 있었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: Park Chung-hee's leadership was in the background, as was the passion of public officials, and sometimes haste and skimping due to meritocracy.

sentences.tgt_sentence: The 2nd and 3rd Five-Year Economic Development Plans were the pride of Park Chung-hee's economy.

sentences.src_sentence: 경제개발 5개년계획도 연륜이 쌓이고 환경이 바뀌자 점차 진화해 나갔다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: As the years accumulated and the environment changed the five-year economic development plan gradually evolved.

sentences.src_sentence: 이전에 없던 교육, 의료 등 사회개발 부문이 처음으로 포함된 것이다.

sentences.tgt_sentence: Despite the fact that the 4th Five-Year Economic Development Plan was unsuccessful in fulfilling its purpose because of the collapse of the Park Chung-hee administration and the overlapping of the 2nd oil shock, it was later upgraded with a more set structure after entering the Chun Doo-hwan administration.

sentences.src_sentence: 계획만 보면 전두환 시대의 제5차 경제개발 5개년계획이 절정이었다.
sentences.tgt_sentence: The 5th Five-Year Economic Development Plan of the Chun Doo-Hwan era was at its peak if you look at the plan alone.

sentences.tgt_sentence: Just before the crisis, an unexpected 'sparkling boom' occurred, in 1977.

sentences.tgt_sentence: The Vietnam War was sees as an opportunity, thus the internationalization of Korean companies began in earnest, and specifically, numerous domestic companies entered overseas construction projects.

sentences.tgt_sentence: It was impossible to summarize the overseas construction specialists and expensive equipment that had been raised so far.

sentences.tgt_sentence: Thanks to a construction boom which arose in Saudi Arabia and other Middle Eastern countries found a suitable breakthrough.

sentences.tgt_sentence: Regardless of politics, from an economic view there were also strange signs that herald the end of the Park Chung-hee administration.
